description: DescriptionHey there! We are Gorillas & we are influencing the way people live their lives. Groceries being delivered to your door in 10 minutes is a concept that up until recently was unimaginable. We’re redefining an industry that has never experienced the rapid changes that we’re creating. You can now be a part of generating this change.About The Growth TeamOur mission is to fuel Gorillas business and all of its functions by providing sound user understanding and executing relevant, timely, and personalised interactions across the lifecycle.About This PositionWe are looking for a marketing-savvy data analyst to help us unlock the true potential of two of our most important assets after our people: our data and our expansion! You will use your analytical mind to push all aspects of the Growth forward and empower the team to make their own data-driven decisions. The role sits within the Growth Analytics function and will involve working closely with Marketing teams, like Growth, Brand and local Social Media teams, to define their needs and translate them into actionable and scalable insights.Your Responsibilities Taking ownership of the growth data and its role as the source of reporting throughout the company.  Consistently expanding the scale of our data solutions. Ensuring growth and country stakeholders within the business have access to relevant reporting in clear dashboards using a variety of tools. Presenting analytical findings to senior stakeholders. Be the point of contact between growth, brand, in Market and engineering / tech teams to organise and streamline requests. Applying your expertise to design and implement new metrics across the business. RequirementsYour profile Minimum 1-2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence or similar roles Experience working in a fast-paced environment, balancing responsibilities and projects A passion for dissecting business and marketing problems to deliver scalable data solutions Able at communicating and presenting information to a range of stakeholders Interested in enabling data driven decision making in marketing and brand Skills Ability to construct dashboards and derive insights from large data-sets (e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, MixPanel) Familiarity with big data tools, data warehousing concepts and SQL queries Nice to have: experience in writing code in Python / R Traits You are an avid learner and love helping others to learn and grow A passion for building a diverse and inclusive environment You love Growth and want to take Gorillas to the next level  A sense of independence and an ability to establish structures or processes to adapt to a constantly evolving domain and environment A passion for marketing and tech with very close collaboration with both technical and non-technical stakeholders You are resourceful and have great communication skills, we require English If you feel this could be you, please do not hesitate to reach out and apply to become part of Gorillas.BenefitsAs a part of the fastest growing startup in Europe, you can benefit from a steep learning curve from day one with a high career growth trajectory. We love seeing our crew blossom & growing with us! With a transparent company culture & stunning team spirit, Gorillas ensures a dynamic & international environment welcome to anyone! Plus, our flexible working arrangements support people at different stages in their lives. We celebrate diversity & are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.If you want to build something you are proud of & you believe in the vision, we want you in the Gorillas fam!DisclaiimerGorillas is an equal opportunity employer, which means we do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionGeneral BusinessMarketingConsultingIndustriesInternetStaffing and RecruitingRetail

Über den JobAs a data-driven company we are currently upscaling our BI and Data team. As Data Analyst you will join a team of Data Engineers, Data Product Managers and BI Specialists to create and maintain a culture of data-backed business decisions and support all of CoachHub's departments.Tasks And ResponsibilitiesYou perform data analysis and data-insights for supporting stakeholders’ decision-makingYou analyze customer behavior and operational performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the Business and improve user experienceYou conduct analytics and A/B testing to evaluate business hypothesesYou define and monitor key metrics, understand root causes of changes to them and identify opportunities to improve our processesYou create and help analyze reports and dashboards to support data-driven decision-making.Dein ProfilYou have strong experience doing analysis like: funnel analytics, customer segmentation, user activity modeling, churn analytics and A/B testingYou have a good understanding of SQL for analytics and experience with Python as a data analyticsYou have experience using Looker or other reporting tools like Tableau or Power BIYou have excellent communication skills in English, both written and oralYou are independent, thrive when given autonomy and ownershipWas wir bietenThe opportunity to join a fast-growing start-up company A lot of personal responsibility and ownershipAn extremely steep learning curve in an interdisciplinary team Your commitment has a direct impact on the businessDiverse learning and training opportunities as well as a personal business coachA reduced Urban Sports Club membershipFree choice of hardwareFun in a highly motivated teamCentral Location Berlin or full-remote work support  If we have aroused your interest, we look forward to receiving your application. Ideally, you should already send us your notice period and your salary expectations.Note on data protection: By submitting your application, you agree that we may process your data during the selection process. Your data will not be passed on to third parties and you can request the deletion of your data at any time.Jetzt bewerbenShow moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionEngineeringInformation TechnologyIndustriesInternetStaffing and RecruitingManagement Consulting

Direct message the job poster from KayzenGeorge KoHiring + Operations @ KayzenNote: Previous Experience on Ad-Tech / Mar-Tech is a MUSTAbout KayzenKayzen is the future of mobile marketing — building software that allows mobile app developers to connect with their users. We are a B2B SaaS platform that allows companies to run mobile programmatic marketing in-house.Programmatic marketing, put simply, is the process of automating the buying and selling of digital ads in real-time. Programmatic in-housing takes this one step further by allowing advertisers to fully own the technology stack and skills required in this process.Programmatic in-house is still in its early days when it comes to the mobile advertising market. This is where we have impact!The TeamYou will work with a carefully selected, diverse and globally distributed team from customer success, engineering, data science, design, product and more. We are highly motivated and aligned in our quest to disrupt the multi-billion dollar ad-tech industry.We would like you to be part of our journey, as our Data Analyst (m/f/d).The RoleAs our Data Analyst, you will report directly to our CPO/Co-Founder. Your primary focus will be on building analytics and product features on top of ~10 TB of data that we store every single day across various data centres. You will be in an important role in deriving valuable insights to both our business teams and customers. Apart from your primary tasks, we would love to see you having a growth mindset on contributing to Kayzen’s success. ResponsibilitiesAnalyse several Terabytes of structured data generated per day and identify patterns to derive business recommendationsFormulate questions which help us improve business KPIs and lead your data analysis to find profound answers to those questionsRun data-driven business investigations aiming to improve the performance of our systems through better understanding of the massive amounts of data we have, e.g. to reduce fraud, improve conversion rates, allow for more precise targeting of users and moreWork closely with our client success team to understand our clients' needs and develop ideas on how to solve them with smart data analyticsProvide inputs and recommendations for our data science models and work closely with data scientists to enhance the precision of our prediction modelsWork closely with engineering and product and contribute in all phases of the Product Development Lifecycle Key QualificationsExpertise in data modelling, access, processing and data visualizationStrong analytical skills and experience with Business Intelligence tools and languages (SQL, Python, R, Tableau or other data visualization tools)Comfortable with Big data technologies (Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Pig etc)A willingness to dive deep, experiment rapidly and get things doneHigh degree of pragmatism and business outcome-driven data analysisAttention to detail, data accuracy, and quality of outputBeing passionate about creating great products and experiences for our customersHigh levels of creativity and quick problem-solving capabilities, a self-starter with a goal-driven focusWhat do we offer?A unique opportunity to be part of the change of the Adtech spaceA high degree of responsibility and independenceDirect, day-to-day work experience with the managementA fun, driven, and multinational team in India and GermanyFlexible work-from-home arrangement26 days of annual leaveShow moreShow lessEmployment typeFull-time

description: DescriptionCome build the future with us.Our overall mission is simple: We want Amazon to be the place where our customers can find, discover and buy anything online. Whatever our customers want, we will find the means to deliver it. With your help, Amazon will continue to enable people to discover new worlds and implement innovation. This is your chance to make history.Amazon is looking for Junior Payments Business Analyst, based in Berlin.As one of the largest e-commerce companies in the world, Amazon processes billions of secure on-line transactions via a number of payment mechanisms, including credit cards, direct debit and electronic gift certificates. Transactions are processed on behalf of thousands of merchants, including Amazon.com. Amazon is known across the globe as the most trusted company on the Internet. We are committed to delivering an exceptional customer experience.The Payments Services owns and maintains the software which processes 20+ payment methods worldwide. The Business Operations Team supports the larger Payments Services organization which includes software development, product management and technical operations. The Business Operations team is the first contact for payment transactional issues, receiving escalations from internal clients such as Customer Service, Finance, Accounting and Fraud as well as third party partners and banks relied upon to process payments. Additionally this team is responsible for driving operational efficiencies and escalation reduction opportunities. This team also manages the operational relationship with third party payment partners, advocating for customer experience and driving operational improvements.The Payments Business Analyst is responsible for driving operational excellence across global payments product. In this role you will identify and drive to resolution payments issues impacting customers on a global scale. You will work to identify, execute, and drive projects with internal and external business partners to improve the Customer Payments Experience across Amazon. You will collaborate with teams across Amazon to improve business processes to increase operational efficiencies.The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter that can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment with limited supervision. He or she must be a fast learner, who can quickly absorb the nuances of Amazon's varied payment offerings as well as the behavior of Amazon's internal systems. He or she will be analytical in their decision making, with a demonstrated ability to drive issues to completion.Job Responsibilities Include Work in a deep area of coverage, routinely working on issues ranging from small to large number of customers impacted and driving root cause resolution with engineering teams and/or external partners. Manage operational workflows working with internal business teams in small to medium sized geographies or products. Identify and drive continuous improvement activities. Serves as escalation point for program / project team members. Owns, tracks, or escalates issues to ensure that they are addressed, documented, and resolved. Displays energy and initiative in solving problems. Will follow all possible avenues to get the job done, are proactive. Work requires creativity and judgment. Responsibilities include both routine and non-routine in nature and vary from day to day. Identify and evaluate potential risks/obstacles with minimal direction from program managers. Consult, determine, and execute appropriate corrective action. Proactively drive customer experience and operational excellence for payment methods used by Amazon customers. Successfully build business requirements that technical teams use to implement projects you sponsor.About Our RewardsWe’ll expect you to go the extra mile, but we’ll also make sure you’re well rewarded. As well as a competitive salary and stock units we offer a host of other benefits.If you thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment, you’ll meet your match with us, as you will be part of a vibe of constant improvement, where the things you do one moment, you will not necessarily be doing 6 months later. We don’t like to sit still, which is why we always treat every day like the first day. A day to make more good things happen for our customers. It’s that kind of spirit that drives our success now and keeps us ahead of the competition in the future. And you could be part of it. It’s as simple as this: Work Hard. Have Fun. Make History.Sounds interesting? We look forward to your application. Please apply online and upload your CV and a letter of motivation in English in one document (max. 5 MB).By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.Basic QualificationsFor this position, we expect.. Proficiency in German and English is a Must BA/BS degree Several years relevant experience in customer facing role Demonstrated superior written and oral communications skills with the ability to interact with internal customers and external partners in a professional mannerFurther Qualifications Would Be a Plus..PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Turkish Language proficiency French Language proficiency Italian Language proficiency Payments industry experience Proficiency with SQL, VBA, HTML Strong analytical skills with demonstrated problem solving ability. Skilled in prioritization. Makes the right tradeoffs between schedule, resources, and scope in order to address major risks, challenges and obstacles. Data driven and can successfully obtain and use data to support arguments. Previous experience in which high levels of initiative, judgment, and tact has been demonstrated. Proven ability to operate in high pressure situations and successfully handle multiple priorities and possess a high level of discipline while remaining flexible. Candidate should possess superior customer service skills in dealing with users at all levels in a team environment. Excellent judgment and independent decision making skills. Proven ability to interact effectively in a cross-functional team. Proficient in Microsoft Office suite.Are you interested? We look forward to receiving your application. Please submit your online application including your CV and covering letter in English.Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation or any other assistance, please let the recruiting team know and they will support you with the necessary actions throughout the interview process.Did you know that Amazon is offering various jobs in part-time? If you want to apply, please filter for “part-time” in the job type search section on amazon.jobs.Company - Amazon Deutschland Servcs GmbHJob ID: A1434109Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionGeneral BusinessManagementStrategy/PlanningIndustriesComputer SoftwareInformation Technology and ServicesInternet

making within the organisation Educate and guide stakeholders to design and implement self-service dashboards in Looker Be part of a diverse data team of analysts, engineers and scientists working PositionKAYAK is looking for people who love working with data and have a strong interest in machine learning systems, from recommender systems to reinforcement learning to vision to natural language processing. Good candidates will be well-versed in recent advances in machine learning and will be comfortable quickly testing and iterating on new ideas. Positions at different levels of seniority are available.KAYAK Labs, specifically, is a cross-cutting team focused on riskier projects and innovation across the business. Leveraging ML/AI, optimization, and our unique data assets, we aim for novel, impactful products and breakthrough improvements. We seek to distinguish our brand, to delight our users, and to help our customers experience the world through travel with confidence and peace-of-mind.As part of the Labs team, you’ll collaborate with strong researchers and engineers, and your work will have tangible impact. You will be challenged; you will have an opportunity to shape our business, and by extension, the wider travel industry. You will expand your competence and explore new technologies at the intersection of AI, data engineering, computation, and product delivery at scale.ResponsibilitiesFrame, design and execute your own solutions to modeling problems that will improve user experience and/or optimize key metrics important to the business. Conduct experiments and engage in rapid-prototyping of ideas, making creative use of the data and resources at your disposal. Implement designs in a stable, maintainable, and scalable production-ready form. Extract, process and leverage massive amounts of data to drive successful projects. Engage in group problem-solving, and collaborative team efforts. Communicate and share results in a clear and concise manner.QualificationsComfortable with math, statistics, systems design and coding to the extent necessary to tackle industrial machine learning and data science challenges. A PhD in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics, mathematics, operations research, science, engineering, etc.), is preferred and is a good indicator of sufficient preparation, but is not strictly required: what you can do (or quickly learn to do) is more important. Exposure to a minimum introductory level treatment of the core concepts and methods in machine learning, and some applied experience deploying those methods towards solving data science problems. Familiarity with current machine learning development ecosystems (Python, PyTorch / TensorFlow, Git, etc.) Comfortable collaborating in a dynamic, cross-functional team: you know how to listen, ask questions, build consensus, advocate (with data), and share success. You are willing to assume leadership and ownership over technological, business, or team responsibilities. Strong written and verbal communication skills: you can communicate clearly and effectively with peers and non-technical stakeholders alike. You can explain your plan for solving a business problem clearly, and document your work concisely.Bonus QualificationsWorking knowledge of advanced machine learning theory and methods, whether through experience or (graduate) coursework. Direct experience applying ML/AI in a business environment, and experience distilling high-level business challenges down to concrete modeling problems. Familiarity with bash scripting, relational databases. Familiarity with CI/CD tools and procedures, containerization, and horizontal scaling in latency sensitive ML-centric / production inference settings. Research publication track-record.About KAYAKAt KAYAK we help millions of travelers around the globe make confident travel decisions. KAYAK searches other sites to show travelers the information they need to find the right flights, hotels, rental cars and vacation packages and is the world's leading travel search engine.As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of metasearch brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined. Many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each other's strengths and insights. Together, we're able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.KAYAK is part of Booking Holdings Inc. and operates sites in more than 60 countries and territories.Benefits And Perks6 weeks paid vacation Day off on your birthday Generous retirement plans Annual education budget * Free lunch catering three days per week * Public transportation subsidies * Free German classes * Free Yoga classes * Free massages from Wellnow * No stupid meetings Drinks, coffee, snacks, games etc Regular team events and volunteering opportunities Sport teams (Football, Volleyball, Basketball) Flexible hours In-house gym facilities Universal paid parental leave currently paused due to COVIDDiversity and Inclusion at OpenTable/ KAYAKWe aspire to have a workplace that reflects all of the diverse communities we serve. We know that when we have diverse teams we produce more innovative ideas, products, services, and better business outcomes for our stakeholders. OpenTable/KAYAK is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Whoever you are, just be you.We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionEngineeringInformation TechnologyIndustriesInternetLeisure, Travel & TourismInformation Technology and Services

As a data scientist at Viessmann, you will develop algorithms to generate added value from data, using in particular the data from our IoT products. You will contribute to the development of digital services for our customers as well as to the optimization of our products and processes.Your impact Apply your expertise in data mining, prediction, and statistical analysis to see beyond the numbers  Find and specify relevant use cases to increase customer satisfaction and reduce their carbon footprint  Collaborate with our R&D Team on leveraging our existing IoT machines in the field for product optimization and application development Use your machine learning and AI knowledge to empower advanced data analyses and predictive maintenance Co-create digital solutions in collaboration with different departments in order to enhance customer experience Create prototypical data pipelines to evaluate your insights on a larger scale Cooperate on the productive implementation of your prototypes with our Data Engineers using the Hadoop ecosystem (including Databricks, PySpark) and the Microsoft Azure Stack Who You AreYou are a naturally curious person with a problem-solving mindset. Thanks to your strong communication skills, you have the ability to present complex relationships in a comprehensible way and also enjoy working in cross-functional teams. In addition to that, you have the following qualifications: Master's degree in a quantitative field (mathematics, computer science or physics) with a strong mathematical background (statistics, algebra etc.)  Good knowledge of programming languages, especially Python and its Data Science ecosystem (pandas, scikit-learn, etc.)  Experience in data preparation, data modeling, (exploratory) data analysis, and visualization, as well as machine learning and AI  Experience in cloud computing (Azure, AWS, Google)  Experience with Big Data technologies and distributed computing (PySpark, Dask, etc.)  Experience in working with databases (SQL, NoSQL) and with version control systems (Git) is a plus  Familiarity with business intelligence tools like PowerBI is a plus  Fluency in English, German is a plus Even if you don´t fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press "Apply" anyway. We love your spirit!What Makes Us SpecialOur employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we've created a range of perks for our employees, or as we like to call them, Viessmann family members: The opportunity to do meaningful work that has a direct impact on the organization, our communities & generations to come Thirty annual vacation days  Flexible mobile working options together with the needed technological support Support for future provision through a company pension scheme Subsidized meals in our marketplace restaurant, complete with hangout areas for relaxing and having informal meetings Job Bike and charging stations for your E-car at our Headquarters Support for the whole family: Parent-Child Office, Kids Camp during those long summer holidays, and more Last, but not least: Fun at work and an atmosphere that encourages your ideas! Who We AreLarge corporations tend to think in quarters. Viessmann thinks in generations. With 100+ years of industry expertise, more than 12,000 colleagues, and a turnover of over two billion Euros in 120 countries, we continue to address the most important issues of our time. The energy revolution is here and Viessmann is leading the way in not only sustainability but in the digitalization of energy offerings. Our Headquarters in Allendorf has reduced CO2 emissions by 80%, and by doing so have already fulfilled the government's climate policy goals for 2050. And this is just the start. We develop innovative and customer-centric climate solutions that help safeguard our environment across the globe. How do we do this? Through a multi-tiered strategy that includes investing in our own start-up ventures that complement our world-class product offerings in heating, cooling, and industrial systems.Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionEngineeringInformation TechnologyIndustriesInformation Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareInternet

Direct message the job poster from Travian GamesCarola KnerrDo what you love and love what you doTravian Games GmbH, based in Munich, is a world-renowned self-publishing developer of online games. The company offers its customers complex and multi-layered worlds of experience that are distinguished by their gaming depth, guaranteeing long-lasting gaming enjoyment for the players. A motivated team develops and markets online entertainment for all age groups. Currently, Travian Games offers the following games: Travian: Legends, Rail Nation, Travian Kingdoms, goalunited LEGENDS, Miramagia, Hyperdrome, UnitedGP and Arkheim – Realms at War. They are translated into up to 39 languages and can therefore be enjoyed by fans of long-lasting gaming entertainment all around the world.QUESTYou develop actionable reports on a weekly/monthly basisYou consolidate, validate and aggregate data from different data sourcesYou design and develop complex statistical modelsYou interpret the data and analysis results with goal-oriented recommendationsIn close contact with our game centers and service departments, you provide ongoing in-house data-analytics consulting (including in-game tracking and in-game analytics)You identify areas for further development and improvement of our gamesYou design and implement KPIs that will be used company-wideSKILLSYou have successfully completed studies in a data-oriented discipline (e.g. statistics, mathematics, business informatics)You have experience in data analysisYou have experience in working with SQL, R and/or PythonYou have basic knowledge of tracking toolsYou have an in-depth understanding of analysis and confident handling of large data setsYou have very good and goal-oriented communication skillsYou have a good command of written and spoken EnglishYou are passionate in gamesREWARDSRegular Training & DevelopmentFree RefreshmentsChoose Your WeaponGym CooperationCreative Times & TalksBenefit Regular Socializing & EventsShow moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionAnalystIndustriesComputer Games

Apply NowQualificationsMaster's degree in geology, mineral economics, mining engineering, metallurgical engineering or material science from a reputed instituteWork or internship experience in market research, market analysis, supply and demand analysis, price analysis, economic analysis or database buildingInterest in learning about the industry dynamics of the mining and metals sectorSteel or aluminum market knowledge/experience is a plusSuperior problem-solving and analytical skillsWilling to work in a highly demanding and result-oriented team environmentSelf-motivated and service-orientated work ethicExcellent written and oral communication skillsFluency in German language required in order to be based in Germany Who You'll Work WithYou'll work with our MineSpans team in Wroclaw, Lisbon, Dusseldorf or Brussels. MineSpans is part of McKinsey's Basic Material practice.MineSpans provides mining companies with the strategic business intelligence to support their market analysis and understanding of the metals and mining sector industry dynamics. It combines advanced analytics, a comprehensive database of mining operations, and global mining expertise. MineSpans enables clients to assess and improve their views on costs, supply and demand across mining commodities like iron ore, copper, gold, EV-battery materials, steel, aluminum and others.What You'll DoYou will do research on commodity markets across the Basic Materials domain.In your role, you will help maintain and develop a comprehensive database of mining operations. You will also analyse mines in depth in order to develop a deep understanding on the market.Additionally, you will participate in the company’s knowledge-building efforts by creating knowledge packs around your focus area. You will support consulting teams and clients to conduct auxiliary analyses and you will also have the chance to guide a small team of researchers.Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionProductionAnalystConsultingIndustriesMining & Metals

(Junior) Data / BI Analyst (m/w/d) We, GamesGroup, are an international publishing and marketing partner for independent-minded, midsize development studios of cross-platform (PC/Mobile) free2play games. The developers create and own their games – we market and scale them and cover all administrative and legal aspects of the commercialization, effectively being the developer’s outsourced commercial department. The online/mobile games industry continues to be one of the fastest growing markets worldwide, highly competitive and fast-paced. Technical and gameplay innovations are two of the key drivers that ensure the ongoing expansion of players. We are always looking for talented, dedicated and open-minded colleagues, who want to join and shape our future, who are as enthusiastic as we are to do our part in creating fans for the games of which are proud to be a part of and to be a real partner to our developers. Throughout all phases, Analytics is the backbone of our company – from ingame behaviors to KPI driven marketing, Analytics provides the background for other departments, our operations and decisions. The position is a maternity replacement and, in the beginning, limited to 1 years.Your responsibilities: Translate our games into numbers and provide feedback. Managing, enhancing and controlling of our analytics system. Handling tracking solutions and various data sources; merge, sort and interpret data, make data readable and usable. Developing dashboards, models and forecasts, standard and ad-hoc reports. Work with the product team on game and user analysis. Provide decisive metrics to the marketing team. Be a proactive part of the analytics team. What you bring to the table: Degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Statistics or similar field with mathematical/analytical focus or similar experience / education. Experience in setting up and maintaining data visualization tools (preferably Tableau). Experience in scripting language (preferred Python). First experience in working with Databases/RDMS (preferred MySQL and PostgreSQL). Very good Excel Skills. Analytical, number-driven mindset and detail-oriented and accurate work style. Good communication skills, confidence in presenting numbers and evaluations to the team and to developers. Very good written and spoken English (German optional). What we offer: An opportunity to join the games industry and start a career in this industry. An exciting, international role in a fascinating market. Working on exciting games with newest markets trends and in a fast-paced environment. A great team with international and highly educated colleagues. Autonomy and excellent opportunities for development in a highly dynamic team. An outstanding working atmosphere with flat hierarchies. Working in a flexible, open minded company where transparency is key. An office in the heart of Munich. Relocation support if needed. Other fringe benefits (incl. flexible working hours, partially remote working possible, local transport ticket, contributions to pension fund, monthly company lunch and more). Interested? Apply via the application button.Agency calls are not appreciated.Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionAnalystIndustriesMarketing and Advertising

Job DescriptionWe're looking for a Data Analyst, initially embedded in the marketing team, to form part of a new central Advanced Analytics function. You’ll apply critical thinking, objectivity, and pragmatic data wrangling skills to enable evidence based decisions, and deliver succinct stories. This is a high impact role in a new working environment - you’ll be excited, rather than daunted by that. Able to both influence cross functional leaders with your compelling insights, and roll your sleeves up to kick start best in class data operations, analysis by analysis.Examples of workWork with BI, Controlling, Advanced Analytics, and Marketing channel leads to ensure a first class, proactive, end to end data strategy is operationally effective Define KPIs and build strategic and operational dashboardsEnable marketing channels to make evidence based decisions through data grounded hypothesis, proposal of new tests, analysis of test results, to making new hypothesis Help with marketing budget allocation, using insights from data around the company (inventory quality, user intent, channel elasticity, logistics, customer service) Model channel potential by customer segment across all channels Help to classify our customer segments using your analytical mind and tools, share your insights with respective teamsQualificationsYour skills 3+ years of experience working as an AnalystHighly analytical and logical thinking, able to pick up new topics quickly, from marketing channel levers, website and app analytics, inventory attributes, market factors… anything relevant.Expertise at all stages of data journey - asking right questions, data capture, storage, wrangling, modelling, analysis, and insightsYou are fluent in writing SQL queries and have several years of experience building dashboards in visualisation tools. We use PowerBI.Experience with R or Python is a plus Pragmatism to get day to day work done, while building towards scalable solutions.Know when and how to run experiments and tests with sound statistical relevance. You deliver compelling stories; derived from your analysis, your ability to find signal in the noise, you aren’t swayed by bias in the data, or leadersWhat You'll Receive In ReturnAutonomySupport and coaching from a central functional lead. Exposure to real challenges with big impact, starting with Marketing Chance to work with a purpose driven business, helping the environment Additional InformationWhat else is in it for you?Brandnew office in Berlin Kreuzberg just seconds away from the Spree (starting from January 2021)Truly family-friendly and flexible environment: we do know that lantern festivals at kindergarten and doctor's appointments existReduced Urban Sports Club membership and online yoga class for your well-beingGerman and English language classes once a weekAttractive employee discounts on reBuyRetirement plan and moreDue to Covid-19 our hiring processes are almost exclusively held online and working from the office is voluntary at the moment.At reBuy, we strive every day to live and improve integration and equal opportunities. Of course, this also applies - and in particular - to all our recruiting processes. That's why we seek you, regardless of age, disability, national and social origin, skin color, religion, gender identity and sexual orientation. Just be who you are!Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionInformation TechnologyIndustriesInformation Technology and ServicesInternetStaffing and Recruiting

Zur Verstärkung unseres Analystenteams suchen wir einen Data Analyst (m/w/d) für die Auswertung komplexer Inspektionsdaten. Arbeiten Sie in einem jungen und dynamischen Unternehmen im Bereich Deep-Tech / High-Tech. Unsere Hardware- und Softwarelösungen werden weltweit für die Inspektion von Rohrleitungen in der Energie- und Wasserbranche eingesetzt. Für uns steht es im Vordergrund unsere Umwelt durch Technologie zu schützen. Als Data Analyst arbeiten Sie mit unseren gesammelten Inspektionsdaten. Ihre Analysen und Beurteilungen sind ein entscheidender Teil der Wertschöpfung für unsere Kunden. Ihre Tätigkeit: Sie verwalten, integrieren und analysieren die großen, komplexen Datenmengen, welche von unseren Inspektionsteams mit unserer einzigartigen Technologie aufgezeichnet wurden.Computerbasiert und selbstständig analysieren Sie alle visuellen, graphischen und numerischen Daten auf Auffälligkeiten und Muster.Wir schulen Sie im Umgang mit unseren Softwarelösungen. Komplexität und Verantwortung der von Ihnen übernommenen Analysen erweitern wir sukzessive.Dabei verknüpfen Sie auch Parameter in den aufgezeichneten Rohdaten mit weiteren Erkenntnissen wie Satelliten-, GPS-, Bild-, Ton- und Kartendaten.Sie arbeiten mit an der Erstellung unserer Inspektionsberichte. Ihr Profil:Sie verfügen über eine sehr analytische, verantwortungsvolle, konzentrierte und präzise Arbeitsweise. Dabei kontrollieren Sie Ihre Arbeit laufend selbstständig.Erkenntnisse, Fehler und Vorschläge diskutieren Sie aktiv mit Ihren Kollegen.Belastbarkeit und eine gewisse Flexibilität helfen Ihnen auch bei knappen Zeitplänen die Ruhe zu bewahren.Sie haben ein Studium bzw. eine Ausbildung im Bereich Data Analysis, der Physik, Mathematik, Informatik, Statistik, Elektrotechnik, Ingenieurswissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung erfolgreich abgeschlossen.Kenntnisse im Bereich der analogen und digitalen SignalverarbeitungErfahrung mit der Auswertung großer Datenmengen wünschenswertErfahrung mit der Interpretation von (elektromagnetischen) Messdaten wünschenswertGute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Was wir Ihnen bieten:Einen modernen und sicheren ArbeitsplatzFlexible ArbeitszeitmodelleGeförderte Fort- und WeiterbildungsmaßnahmenKarriere- und Entwicklungschancen in einem jungen, schnell expandierenden und international tätigen High-Tech UnternehmenDie Einbindung in eine familiäre Unternehmenskultur, mit einem breit aufgestellten, interdisziplinären Team, mit flacher Hierarchie und kurzen EntscheidungswegenModerne Büros, wo gern auch mal ein Feierabendbier getrunken wird Wenn wir Ihr Interesse geweckt haben, dann melden Sie sich bei uns und werden Sie fester Teil unseres Teams. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung mit Gehaltswunsch und frühestmöglichem Starttermin an:InspectorX GmbHcareer@inspectorx.comwww.inspectorx.comShow moreShow lessEmployment typeFull-time

You will be working closely together with multiple teams throughout the company in setting clear data structures, key reporting and analysis.TasksYour tasks will include (but are not limited to): Own data projects from data source integration, ensuring data quality to reporting and providing insights Get a deep understanding of operations to be able to design optimal data structures, ensure data quality and high quality insights Maintain and continuously improve core monthly financial reporting Closely work with CEO and VP Finance in various key reports and analysis Continuously design and maintain dashboards for different stakeholders to support them with decision making  Conducting deep analysis for fundamental business decisions Assisting throughout all departments in automating and optimizing processes relating to data Requirements  You have finished your studies in Engineering, Business, Data Science or similar with good results You’ve gained at least one year (preferably two years) of relevant work experience You have excellent skills in SQL, VBA, and Excel, Python and R is a plus You have experience manipulating large datasets You have a strong interest in business-related topics You love to work independently and approach challenges proactively You enjoy problem solving and have extreme attention to detail Your English is business fluent You are a team player and love to contribute to our Pamono community Benefits An exciting, challenging position with lots of responsibility and space for personal development Working in a diverse highly international team Flexible working hours and working from home set up possible (from Berlin) Actively shaping an inspiring E-commerce-business Benefits such as team events, free fruit, drinks, and more Dog-friendly office Interested in the role? At Laserhub, we have metal running through our veins, and with our procurement platform for metal parts we are leading the very traditional sheet metal industry into the glorious age of full digitalization. At laserhub.com, end customers and metal parts manufacturers come together via a lean, digital process. Instead of spending many days or weeks on a single order, everyone can work with unprecedented efficiency, fulfilling their demands just in a few days and for multiple orders. Since 2017, our team has demonstrated that our concept is well received by the market – now we want to play a big part in making the entire metalworking industry digital. In order to achieve our goal, we are looking for an excellent employee for our Data Team asData Analyst (m/f/d)Your mission: In this position you are a member of Laserhub’s Data Team and you will help make Laserhub a data-driven company with your passion for data analytics. You will take over responsibility in providing, analyzing and interpreting data across the organization to enable efficient decision-making. In order to achieve that goal you will do the following: You make the data from our data warehouse consumable through LookML modelling (Data Warehouse Modelling) You closely work alongside the teams to understand business needs. You help gathering requirements for further use cases in cooperation with departments across the organization. You then use these requirements to define additional data sources. Moreover, you help defining KPIs and reporting for business areas together with responsible stakeholders You are responsible for interpreting data, analysing the results and reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business You conduct ad-hoc deep dives on specific topics that produce sound, actionable insights You identify patterns and trends in data sets Moreover, you are always open to support data engineers e.g. in constructing and maintaining our data pipelines Your profile: 2+ years of relevant experience in data analytics Background in quantitative studies, e.g in the field of Data Science, Informatics, Business Informatics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business Admin with focus on IT You show high proficiency in SQL ideally LookML You have experience with with a BI landscape like Looker (or similar) You have an understanding of DWH concepts, architectures and technologies (e.g. BigQuery, Redshift) as well as ETL concepts, tools and technologies (e.g. Dataflow, Airflow) You’d put the labels communicative, enthusiastic to learn and analytical as well as problem-solving mind on yourself Teamwork makes the dream work: You love to share your knowledge and work with the team You have excellent written and spoken capability in English language You ideally have sound programming skills (e.g. Python)  Experience with web-/mobile tracking tools (e.g. Segment) would be an additional plus Your milestones: Within your first month at Laserhub you will be fully onboarded into the team as well as tools and you will make yourself familiar with all data topics Within 2 months you will understand the data analytics needs and challenges of the company and get a good understanding of our current setup Within 6-12 months you will bring our company to the next level of decision-making based on data Why Laserhub? A one-time opportunity to help build an exciting B2B business model with scaling potential We believe in fairness, transparency and helpfulness in everyday work Your personal development is important to us, therefore we promote the internal transfer of knowledge and strengthen your “zone of genius” All our employees hold company shares in Laserhub You can arrange your working day according to your needs with flexible working hours, home office days and the No-Meeting-Wednesday Location: Stuttgart / remote | When do you start? As soon as possibleIf you would like to bring in new ideas and take ownership, our startup environment seems to be the perfect fit. Let’s upload your application via the “Apply button” at the job ad on our careersite!Laserhub GmbH, Eberhardstr. 1, 70173 Stuttgart, www.laserhub.comShow moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionInformation TechnologyIndustriesInformation Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareInternet

Produce sample code, documentation and tutorials for not only our APIs, but APIs across the whole mobile ecosystem. Help developers start quickly and explore ways how they can make their apps and games more successful. In this we expect you to conceptualize, build and execute a project from end-to-end - from concept through implementation and delivery.We're looking for a Data Analyst to be part of our client-centric team. We are building a "data pipeline as a service" service that aims to deliver raw data, reports, and automated decisions to our clients' data warehouses or tools. We do this around a business niche - mobile marketing - that involves highly generalizable business processes and tall amounts of data. This will allow you to work as a Data Analyst for multiple companies at once. This position is ideally in Berlin, but remote can be considered., * Enjoy creating dashboard reporting analytics and fluent in SQL: Delivering actionable analytics to our clients is a big part of what we do. We aim to get meaningful, trusted metrics in front of them as quickly as possible using various BI tools depending on our customer's choice: Tableau, Looker, Metabase, Mode, Google Data Studio, Periscope, etc. A goal for both roles is to produce code and do at least one write-up a week.Write in Python, enjoy creating Jupyter/Google Colab/Streamlit Notebooks and be proficient in scripting. If you are not fluent with Python, knowledge of another programming language - such as Javascript - is required. You should be confident to be able to ramp up your python skills quicklyWho You AreScope and Complexity: You've mastered several technologies and are able to onboard others. You can independently manage technical aspects of multiple projects with increasing complexityCommunication and People Skills: You can explain complex technical problems to non-technical people, and can present problems and solutions to managementOwnership and Impact: You pay attention to details and enjoy delivering accurate analytics. You'll partner closely with the product to manage the scope and deliverables for our roadmap. To succeed you need a Growth Data Infrastructure (GDI) so that user data analysis may be turned into profitable actions. We have helped some of your (and the world's) biggest apps.You might not see us, but we have a powerful presence in the industry and have developed a highly regarded reputation within the gaming and mobile advertising ecosystem globally. Remote working is in our DNA. We are a diverse and highly collaborative team based all around the world. Whether on the go, in the subway, or at home on the sofa, Babbel supports those who enjoy learning outside of work or school. Since its founding in 2007, the company has grown to become the market leader in app based language learning. In total, Babbel offers 14 learning languages, from English to Indonesian. Professional courses are readily available via the Babbel website as well as on your smartphone or tablet. At Babbel, 750 team members from over 50 different countries work hard to set standards for creating a new learning experience.We are looking for a Data Analyst to start immediately as part of our Business Intelligence Team in Berlin. DescriptionLocations: Dortmund, Hamburg and MunichAmazon is a company of builders. A philosophy of ownership carries through everything we do — from the proprietary technologies we create to the new businesses we launch and grow. You’ll find it in every team across our company; from providing Earth’s biggest selection of products to developing ground-breaking software and devices that change entire industries, Amazon embraces invention and progressive thinking. Amazon is continually evolving; it’s a place where motivated employees thrive, and ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results. It’s as simple as this: we pioneer.With every order made and parcel delivered, customer demand at Amazon is growing. And to meet this demand, and keep our world-class service running smoothly, we're growing our Operations team across Europe. We are seeking a savvy, motivated Graduate Analysts to join our available roles in the Fulfilment Center Finance team.About The RoleAre you passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insight that impacts daily business decision of Amazon? Does the prospect of dealing with massive volume of data excite you? Amazon has culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. During our day-to-day operations, tons of data is generated which is leveraged to make our important business decisions.As a Graduate Analyst you will be analyzing and driving improvements to make sure the organization is fit for the future. You will do so by developing queries, macros and tools to support your day-to-day function alongside diving deep into the problems you encounter. You will work with key stakeholders to ensure that decisions are made and actioned which will allow our operations to run as efficiently as possible. You will challenge the unknown and try to drive improvement into key areas of our business.A successful candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, is comfortable accessing and working with big data from multiple sources, and passionately partners with the business to identify strategic opportunities and deliver results. They should have an internal drive to answer “why?” questions, excellent analytical abilities, strong technical skills, as well as superior written and verbal communication skills. They would be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail), and enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment.You would be a great fit for this role if you enjoy and excel at: Using your analytical skills to generate and implement innovative and disruptive ideas Solving complex analytical problems and drawing conclusions from large data sets Continuously learning new skills and knowledge areas to grow, develop, and better serve our customers Working with a broad set of stakeholders from diverse and dynamic teamsJob responsibilities Collecting, analyzing and coordinating quantitative data and creating meaningful reports/dashboards to define business improvement and cost reductions Root cause analysis and uncovering core issues using data, then assisting the business improve and creating new measures Recommending, developing, and implementing policies, processes and programs that guide the organization in maintaining and improving its current position and profitability Establishing and maintaining accurate operating and business metrics Providing and communicating reporting and analysis to senior stakeholders Developing the right performance indicators and maintaining them at scale Working with data source providers and technology teams to ensure that key decision data is accurate, automated and timely Handling complex priorities and providing level-headed guidance during ambiguous/unexpected eventsBasic QualificationsWe want to hire the world’s brightest minds, and offer them an environment in which they can relentlessly improve the experience for our customers. Recent graduate from a degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Accounting, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Supply Chain, Logistics or similar discipline Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (i.e. macros, pivots, lookups, VBA) Advanced proficiency in SQL/ETL Understanding and previous use of large-scale reporting/visualization tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau) Fluent in English, with strong written and oral communication skills Experience making recommendations and decisions based on complex analyses and data Measured demonstration of problem solving and root cause analysis Highly analytical, detail-oriented and professional business sense; proven ability to develop new ideas, creative solutions and demonstrated experience implementing such mechanisms to result Ability to meet tight deadlines, prioritize workload and achieve effective results in a progressive, ever-growing and often ambiguous environment; effective multi-tasking skills are vitalPreferred Qualifications Master’s degree preferred in a business or analytical field Knowledge of Python or R Proficiency in a second European language a plus (e.g. French, German, Spanish, Italian) Knowledge of project management, handling multiple priorities, and working with varied stakeholders Passion and interest in manufacturing, distribution center or logistics processes and systems a plus Previous work experience – a summer job, internship; if it’s an experience in a related field or business, even betterCompany - Amazon Logistik Dortmund GmbHJob ID: A1449427Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionFinanceInformation TechnologyAccounting/AuditingIndustriesComputer SoftwareInformation Technology and ServicesInternet

Data Scientist 80 - 100% / Neuchâtel  Statistik zählt. Auch für Sie. Sie interessieren sich für die Anwendung von Datenwissenschaft («Data Science») für das Gemeinwohl in der ganzen Schweiz («for public good»). Sie haben in den letzten Jahren datenwissenschaftliche Projekte im Rahmen eines kontinuierlichen Verbesserungszyklus in verschiedenen Bereichen durchgeführt. Ihre Aufgaben  In fachlicher, technischer, organisatorischer, finanzieller und personeller Hinsicht die Abwicklungen von Dienstleistungsanfragen im Bereich der Datenwissenschaft leiten (Data Science Engineering) Mit Dateningenieuren aus dem Dienst «Data & Methods Engineering» zusammenarbeiten, um neue Datenströme für Datenbesitzer und Verbraucher abzubilden, zu produzieren, umzuwandeln und zu testen, indem die am besten geeigneten Werkzeuge und Technologien ausgewählt werden  Das Konzipieren, Planen, Umsetzen, Implementieren und Weiterentwickeln von IKT-Infrastrukturen und Tools für die Datenwissenschaft unterstützen  Die Qualität und die Einhaltung der Grundwerte des DSCC bei den verwendeten datenwissenschaftlichen Methoden, Praktiken und Techniken überprüfen. Die Verantwortung für die Qualität der datenwissenschaftlichen Methoden in den selbst betreuten Dienstleistungsanfragen tragen  Ihr Profil  Masterabschluss (MSc) im Bereich Datenwissenschaft, Mathematik, Statistik, Machine Learning, Physik, Operations Research, Informatik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet  Nachgewiesene erste praktische Erfahrung (vorzugsweise mindestens 1-3 Jahre) als Datenwissenschaftler/in in einer öffentlichen Verwaltung, einer Universität und/oder im Privatsektor  Ausgeprägtes analytisches und konzeptionelles Denken und Handeln sowie innovativer Gestaltungswille. Affin gegenüber ingenieurwissenschaftlichem Denken. Hohe Beratungskompetenz. Ausgezeichnete Kommunikation, sowohl in zwei Amtssprachen als auch in Englisch  Erste praktische Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und bei der Operationalisierung von konkreten Anwendungsfällen im Bereich der Datenwissenschaft mit entsprechender Produktentwicklung  Sichere Beherrschung von R und/oder Python. Fundierte Erfahrung einiger typischer Frameworks (z.B. mlr, caret, NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, Spark ML, Keras, TensorFlow, Theano oder gurobipy). Kenntnisse wissenschaftlicher Tools wie Jupyter Notebooks und Git. Erste praktische Erfahrung in der Anwendung von Datenbanken, Programmierschnittstellen und Webtechnologien sind von Vorteil  Zusätzliche Informationen Für weitere Auskünfte wenden Sie sich bitte an Christine Choirat, Sektionschefin, tél. click applyInterne Referenz: DSds2104 Über uns Das Bundesamt für Statistik (BFS) ist das nationale Kompetenzzentrum der öffentlichen Statistik der Schweiz. Es produziert und publiziert statistische Informationen über wichtige Lebensbereiche unserer Gesellschaft und ergänzt diese durch übergreifende Analysen und Indikatorensysteme. Diese Informationen dienen der Meinungsbildung in der Bevölkerung sowie der Planung und Steuerung von zentralen Politikbereichen und leisten einen wichtigen Beitrag für ein modernes demokratisches Staatswesen.Informationen zur Sektion «Datenwissenschaft»Espace de l'Europe 10, 2010 NeuchâtelDie Bundesverwaltung achtet die unterschiedlichen Bedürfnisse und Lebenserfahrungen ihrer Mitarbeitenden und fördert deren Vielfalt. Gleichbehandlung geniesst höchste Priorität.Die Ämter des EDI engagieren sich systematisch für gute Arbeitsbedingungen und die Gesundheit ihrer Mitarbeitenden und sind mit dem Label Friendly Work Space ausgezeichnet.Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionEngineeringInformation TechnologyIndustriesInformation Technology and ServicesResearchStaffing and Recruiting

Interessieren Sie sich für Algorithmen und Analysen und sind sicher im Umgang mit einer Data-Science-nahen Programmierumgebung- Sehen Sie Ihre Zukunft im Bereich Big Data- Dann machen Sie Ihren entscheidenden Karriereschritt, bewerben Sie sich bei Brunel und erleben Sie mit uns die Vielfalt des Engineerings. Denn wir suchen Sie als Data Scientist.Arbeitsbeschreibung Sie entwickeln Daten- und Algorithmen basierte Methoden zur Lösung komplexer und ungewöhnlicher Zusammenhänge. Dazu verbinden Sie Technologien, Konzepte und Statistik zu innovativen Lösungen, die sich vom Prototyp bis hin zur skalierbaren Unternehmenslösung entwickeln können. Darüber hinaus bearbeiten Sie strukturierte und unstrukturierte Daten auf und analysieren diese, dabei erkennen Sie Muster und wenden Verfahren aus den Bereichen Data-Mining, Predictive-Analytics und Machine-Learning spielend an. Ebenso identifizieren und bewerten Sie unbekannte Beziehungen in Daten, um businessrelevante Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und sind für die Durchführung explorativer Datenanalysen in komplexen Datenstrukturen zuständig.Ihr Profil Studium der Informatik/Mathematik/Physik oder ein vergleichbares naturwissenschaftliches Studium sowie Knowhow in der Datenanalyse und grundfundierte Statistik- Mathematik Kenntnisse Gute Kenntnisse in mindestens einer Data-Science-nahen Programmierungsumgebung wie R, Python, Matlab (oder ähnliche) und Erfahrung in relationalen Datenbanken und NoSQL-Datenbanken sowie mit Apache Hadoop Frameworks Wünschenswert wären praktische Erfahrungen mit Advanced-Analytics-Methoden wie Data-Mining, Predictive- Analytics oder Machine-Learning Fließende Deutsch- und EnglischkenntnisseWir BietenBei uns arbeiten Sie unbefristet und in Festanstellung. Darüber hinaus bieten wir Ihnen einen Haustarifvertrag, der auf die Gehaltsstrukturen der verschiedenen Berufsgruppen zugeschnitten ist und Qualifikation sowie Berufserfahrung honoriert. Neben den tariflich gesicherten Sozialleistungen eines expandierenden Unternehmens bieten wir Ihnen die Möglichkeit, sich entsprechend Ihres individuellen Erfahrungsschatzes persönlich und fachlich weiterzubilden.Über BrunelArbeiten bei Brunel bedeutet: Attraktive Arbeitsaufgaben, außergewöhnliche Karriereperspektiven, die Sicherheit eines expandierenden Ingenieurdienstleisters und die ganze Vielfalt des Engineerings und der IT. Allein in der DACH-CZ Region verfügen wir über 45 Standorte und Entwicklungszentren mit akkreditiertem Prüflabor und weltweit über 100 Standorte mit mehr als 12.000 Mitarbeitern in über 40 Ländern. Mehr als 45 Jahre international erfolgreich und über 25 Jahre in Deutschland. Stillstand bedeutet Rückschritt – mit Brunel können Sie etwas bewegen!Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionEngineeringInformation TechnologyIndustriesInformation Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareAutomotive

## Sind Sie ein Beweger?Beweger ziehen leidenschaftlich an einem Strang – mit Innovationsgeist und Kreativität entwickeln sie schon heute die Produkte von morgen. Beweger haben Schmalz zum Markt führer in der Automatisierung mit Vakuum sowie für ergonomische Handhabungssysteme gemacht. Sind Sie ein Beweger? The Global Data team at OLX Group is responsible for building algorithmic solutions to facilitate transactions between buyers and sellers, for building the global infrastructure, tools and platforms that support data collection, processing, and access for a multitude of business lines across the organization, and delivering tangible impact for the business. We are developing personalisation technologies and optimization strategies that have a direct impact on OLX’s users as well as the company's bottom line.You will be encouraged to work with cross-functional stakeholders across multiple companies, to engage in research of state-of-the-art machine learning, in the areas of user segmentation, image metadata extraction (including multi-label classification and tagging with deep learning), semi-supervised learning, and more. Applying these methods to core OLX product platforms deployed in the cloud that are affecting the user experience for millions of visitors per month, rolling your solutions to production, analysing model results offline and online, and measuring site impact.You will also be a mentor and a thought leader for the practice of Data Science and Analytics across the organizations that constitute the OLX Group, finding opportunities to have impact not only for the business and our users, but also for the community of Data Scientists spread across our many international hubs.What You Will Be Doing Leading projects and initiatives done in collaboration with local Data Science and Data Engineering teams across the Group Collaborating with your Data Engineering peers within the Global team to ensure we deliver tools and platforms that enable and amplify the work of our key internal stakeholders Working hands-on and drive from technical side data science efforts in fields like trust and safety, deal prediction, search, and monetization.  Helping to formulate data science solutions in order to improve business jointly with product managers and engineers. Ensuring successful achievement of research and development objectives through stakeholder management and mentoring of more junior Data Scientists. Working on optimizing the models according to the requirements of the specific use case and collaborating with other team members to bring in production and scale machine learning solutions. Measuring the impact of your models against company goals. Working in an agile environment to deliver high-quality software against schedules. What Are We Looking For Ability to lead cross functional initiatives that drive scalable impact An eye for proactively identifying opportunities for impact in multiple domains and in collaboration with multiple teams Ability to envision the future and articulate it to a broad community of Data Scientists and other key stakeholders A deep understanding of machine learning techniques and experience applying them to solve customer / business problems Track record in leading cross-functional initiatives that span across the organization Industry experience creating and productionizing machine learning algorithms at scale Excited by the chance to directly impact the daily experience and happiness of millions of people around the world by matching supply and demand. Experience with Tensorflow or other deep learning frameworks.  A strong engineering background with good knowledge of Python and exposure to one more programming language (Kotlin, Java, etc), as well as engineering best practices. Experience writing SQL queries and handling large amounts of data Nice to have Experience with cloud based tools for production use (e.g., AWS Athena, AWS Sagemaker, AWS Spectrum, AWS Kinesis) or the GCP equivalent. Experience building large-scale batch and real-time data pipelines with open source data processing frameworks like Spark. Experience with platforms for programmatically authoring, scheduling and monitoring workflows (e.g. Apache Airflow). Experience driving initiatives such as Tech Radar for Data Science and interacting with external groups (e.g. Amazon ML Solutions Lab or similar) to formulate and progress the Data Science Tech agenda What We Offer Competitive compensation and benefits Contributing to the global OLX Group A passionate and diverse team of data scientists spanning several tech hubs across the globe. The opportunity to learn from each other and become better every day Competitive salary and great benefits Company Mobile phone, laptop of your choice: Laptop MacBook Pro, Windows or Linux, Notebook, PC, any tool you might need About Us OLX Group is one of the world’s fastest-growing networks of trading platforms. We operate more than 20 well-loved local brands, including Avito, OLX, Property24, Otomoto, and many more across 30+ countries on 5 continents. We shape the future of trade to unlock the hidden value in everything. This is how we do it: We unlock value for our 300 million monthly users, helping them buy and sell cars, find housing, get jobs, buy and sell household goods, and more. We unlock value for entrepreneurs and businesses, helping them find customers. We unlock value in the world’s limited resources, by inspiring more conscious consumption through trade. We unlock value within our team of 10,000+ people. We invest in ourselves and each other to reach our full potential.  We are committed to building an inclusive culture that seeks out the diverse perspectives and experiences of our people and becomes a company superpower and strategic competitive advantage. We avoid bureaucracy and empower our teams to innovate. OLX Group combines the spirit and agility of a startup with our global scale and the backing of Prosus, one of the largest consumer internet groups in the world. We are turning Diversity & Inclusion into our superpower and competitive advantage. We encourage people of all races, ethnicities, disabilities, ages, gender identity or expression, backgrounds and experiences to consider applying for this role.Show moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionEngineeringInformation TechnologyIndustriesMarketing and AdvertisingInternetStaffing and Recruiting

Description Syngenta  is a global leader in agriculture; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.For our newly created Plant Phenotyping team we are currently looking for:Phenotyping Data Scientist (m/f/d) Location: remote in any of the European countries. The successfully hired person will drive the implementation of digital phenotyping strategies and projects through data-driven trait prioritization. The main purpose of the role is to translate data into insights and biological knowledge using algorithms for analysis and visualization, presentation and discussion of results in project team meetingsAccountabilities  Perform network-based and ML-based predictive analytics for large-scale datasets of digital agronomic traits to support agricultural data science and machine intelligence applications across crop scales   Work in close collaboration with Data Science and Breeding teams to determine the right approaches for digital trait prioritization   Run analytics and optimize processes in interaction with IT/R&D-IT   Closely interact with Pipeline Enablement, Data Science and Field Crop / Vegetables teams   Actively scout the algorithms landscape for optimization of digital trait discovery, trait prioritization and predictions  Qualifications Knowledge, experience & capabilities   Postgraduate or PhD in data science, bioinformatics, informatics, computational biology or mathematics or a related discipline   3yrs + experience in bioinformatics preferably in plant biology research industries   Demonstrated experience and skills in statistical data analysis, clustering/classification, multivariate analysis and machine learning complemented by strong data fusion, data visualization and presentation skills   Demonstrated coding ability in R/Bioconductor, Python, Bash, Java, SQL etc.   Familiarity with Unix and high-performance computing environments   Knowledge of fundamental concepts in automated plant phenotyping, statistics and bioinformatics including biological databases and web tools   In-depth knowledge of data exploitation, predictive science and statistics, preferably in the context of biological or agricultural Research and Development   Appreciation of the value in data - experience in managing, analyzing or using complex data to make scientific or business decisions   Sound understating of AI, Augmented Reality, Sensor Analytics, GIS environments would all be beneficial   Ability to analyze heterogeneous agricultural data (phenotypic, evaluation data, weather and Enviropig data), optimize workflows and ensure proper documentation   Ability to use Data to drive decision making process   Fluent in written and oral English   Ability to work in an interdisciplinary team   Learning agility, scientific curiosity with a problem-solving mindset, an enthusiastic and collaborative spirit   Ability to translate breeders/biologists/project team’s questions into analytical strategies and methods   Ability to communicate clearly at all organizational levels  Interested? We look forward to receiving your online application including all relevant documents (cover letter, CV, certificates) – reference number 18026261. Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.   Please note that this role is available for applicants based everywhere in Europe.  #LI- B S1Primary LocationDEU-Bad Salzuflen-Bad SalzuflenOther LocationsGermany, France, United Kingdom, SwitzerlandJobR&D - ResearchShow moreShow lessSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionResearchScienceIndustriesFarmingBiotechnologyChemicals

Warum SoftwareONE? SoftwareONE ist ein weltweit führendes Plattform-, Lösungs- und Dienstleistungsunternehmen und unterstützt Organisationen mit innovativen Lösungen bei der Budgetierung sowie Optimierung ihrer globalen IT‐Kosten von On‐Premises- bis hin zu Cloud-Umgebungen. Wir verfügen über umfassende Expertise, Kunden im Sinne einer optimalen Cloud-Strategie zu beraten und Geschäftserfolge durch eine Cloud-Infrastruktur dauerhaft zu steigern. Data Scientist (gn) Vollzeit, unbefristet, Standort: Leipzig oder remote im Home-OfficeWir lieben Daten! Viele unserer Kunden haben bereits eine Menge Daten, wollen aber zukünftig noch mehr erfassen. Die Nutzung von Daten zur Gewinnung von Informationen und schließlich zu Ableitung von Erkenntnissen ist längst übliche Praxis. Die rasante Entwicklung von neuen Technologien und Rechenkapazitäten bietet aber ständig neue Möglichkeiten, die wir für unsere Kunden nutzen.Data Scientists übernehmen die fachliche Datenanalyse. Das heißt sie finden Strukturen, treffen Ableitungen und nehmen Transformationen vor. Das Aufgabengebiet  Dein Job ist es, aus Unmengen von (unstrukturierten und strukturierten) Daten, valide Zusammenhänge zu finden.  Ziel ist es dabei diese Erkenntnisse und Mechanismen für konkrete Automatisierungen und Anwendungen nutzbar zu machen.  Kenntnisse und Fähigkeiten Du solltest bereits praktische Erfahrungen mit einem Machine Learning Thema gesammelt haben. Dazu kennst du dich mit folgenden Technologien aus:  Mindestens eine der folgenden Sprachen: Python, R, Java oder Scala    Sicherer Umgang mit mindestens einer der gängigen Datenbanken (nicht Administration): Oracle DB, MySQL, Microsoft DB, Comos DB oder ähnliches  Fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse im Umgang mit mindestens einem ML Framework: Tensorflow, CNTK, Scikit-Learn oder PyTorch   Solides Verständnis in den Bereichen supervised und unsupervised Learning    Grundlegendes Verständnis im Umgang mit Data Science und Machine Learning Methoden: ANN, SVM, SOM, Naive Bayes, Regression und Decision Algorithmen   Fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse im Umfeld Artificial Intelligence: Natural Language Processing, Image bzw. Object Recognition, Regression  Sicherer Umgang bei der Informationsvisualisierung: D3.js, GGplot, Pyplot oder Gnuplot   Du solltest die grundsätzlichen Funktionskonzepte verstehen und dann bei uns entsprechende Expertise aufbauen.  Erste Projekterfahrung mit Kunden solltest du mitbringen.  Fließende Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse. Folgende Kenntnisse Machen Dich Noch Interessanter Sicher im Umgang mit Data Science Arbeitsumgebungen: Visual Studio Code, Jupyter, Apache Spark oder R-Studio    Fortgeschritten im Umgang mit weiteren Datenbanken und Data Science Frameworks: Pandas, Keras, Hadoop und NoSQL Datenbanken   Kenntnisse im Bereich Verteiltes Rechnen (PySpark)   Praktische Erfahrung im Bereich Deep Learning: Semantische Text Analyse, Text Translation, Image Recognition    Data Pipelines wie bspw. Kafka, Redis, Flink oder ElasticSearch   Microsoft Services in Azure wie bspw. Databricks, DataFactory, Cognitive Services und PowerBI  Das haben wir zu bieten  Eine Karriere bei einem zukunftssicheren Unternehmen mit einer einmaligen Unternehmenskultur  Eine top Mitarbeiter-Bewertung auf kununu!  Wir bieten Dir die Möglichkeit zum Arbeiten im Homeoffice. Aber auch im Office haben wir keinen Dresscode und du kannst anziehen womit auch immer du dich wohl fühlst.  Eine Vielzahl an Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten die sich an Deinen Interessen und Bedürfnissen orientieren  Wir vertrauen Dir! Unsere Arbeitszeiten sind flexibel und werden nicht erfasst  Eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance mit 30 Urlaubstagen und der Möglichkeit zum Sabbatical  Eine offene Kommunikationskultur sowie vielfältige Möglichkeiten zur aktiven Mitgestaltung und Verantwortungsübernahme  Ein modernes und faires Vergütungsmodell, das sich an deiner Qualifikation, deiner Verantwortung und deinem Erfolg orientiert  Mit unserem Mitarbeiteraktienprogramm kannst du auch finanziell an unserem weiteren Erfolg teilhaben  Umfangreiche Mitarbeiterangebote wie zum Beispiel freie Getränke, Snacks und eine klasse Kantine an unserem Leipziger Standort oder legendäre gemeinsame Events  Eine top technische Ausstattung für deinen neuen Job mit mobilen Workstations und state of the art Software Tools! SoftwareONE ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Gleichberechtigung steht.Mit "Mitarbeiterzufriedenheit" als einen unserer Kernwerte, setzen wir uns leidenschaftlich für Diversität ein und verpflichten uns selbst, ein inklusives Arbeitsumfeld für jede Kollegin und jeden Kollegen zu schaffen.Letztendlich möchten wir, dass all unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter bei SoftwareONE den Höhepunkt ihrer Karriere erleben.
